meanings.definition: An animal or plant produced by breeding two different species or varieties
meanings.sent1: The crossbreed of a horse and a zebra is called a zorse.
meanings.sent2: The farmer was excited to see the new crossbreed of roses he had created.
meanings.sent3: The zoo visitors were amazed by the unusual crossbreed of a lion and a tiger.
meanings.sent4: The crossbreed of a cactus and a succulent resulted in a unique plant with spiky leaves.
meanings.sent5: The scientist studied the genetic makeup of the crossbreed to understand its traits better.

meanings.definition: To breed two different species or varieties together
meanings.sent1: The farmer decided to crossbreed his sheep with a different breed to improve wool quality.
meanings.sent2: In order to create a stronger plant, the botanist chose to crossbreed two different types of flowers.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully suggested to crossbreed strawberries and bananas to make a new dessert.
meanings.sent4: The idea to crossbreed technology and nature sparked a wave of innovation in the industry.
meanings.sent5: The breeder carefully planned how to crossbreed the horses to achieve the desired characteristics.
